item.title: Report E-2024090042
item.description:
Report E-2024090042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-11T09:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: DALTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HIGHWAY TRANSPORT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Truck left the facility after being loaded. The washout cap was cross threaded and the material splashed out of the washout for approximately 0.9 miles. The truck pulled over and called in to Highway Transport Chemical (HTC). HTC called Environmental Management, Inc. (EMI). EMI called a local environmental emergency response company, Marion Environmental. Marion personnel spread soda ash on the spill and then pressure washed the material. Storm drains were protected by Marion. The wash water was collected with a vacuum truck.

The package was marked as UN1263, Paint, 3, PGIII, and when it was investigated further the package was found to be leaking. One of the cans was dented causing the liquid inside to leak. It is unclear how the can became damaged inside the package. The package has been placed in a salvage drum and will be sent out for disposal.

  • Description: On August 27, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2810 was damaged by other freight and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. CE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN2810-impacted loading dock floor. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon overpack and all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums that were staged onsite.

item.title: Report X-2024090439
item.description:
Report X-2024090439

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-11T09:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 36000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While working in MR05 track, Harrison Yard, Memphis, TN, a CN Mechanical employee observed a clear liquid leaking from the top of UTLX 125236, (Load, Sulfuric Acid, UN1830,) down the side of the tank car to the ground. CN Mechanical Supervisor notified CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) Vaughan and CN Police. CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) Vaughan performed an inspection of the tank car and found the liquid line cap to be #less than tool tight# and easily manipulated by hand, was actively leaking from the threads onto the tank car and to the ground. Additionally, the air valve plug was found #less than tool tight# and could be manipulated by hand. The air valve was in the fully closed position. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) responded to the site and slowly vented through the air valve to depressurize the tank car. The DGO applied new Teflon tape and tightened the liquid eduction line cap tool tight using a 24# pipe wrench. New Teflon was applied to the air valve plug and properly installed and tightened #tool tight# using a 24# pipe wrench. A CN contractor responded to decontaminate the tank car and the ground. Tank car was secured and set out to the CN Car Shop to await requalification by MRU.

  • Description: UPON INSPECTION IF PACKAGE IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE hazardous materials certification DID NOT HAVE THE PACKAGE LISTED ON THE PAPERWORK. ALSO, THE PACKAGE WAS NOT SHIPPMENT USING HAZMAT SERVICE CODE FOR UN1689 Sodium cyanide, solid. THE SHIPPER WOULD NOT PICK UP THE PACKAGE FROM THE TERMINAL. THERE IS NO VISIBLE DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR UNDAMAGED PACKAGE MISSING THE CORRECT HAZMAT DOCUMENTS AND AWAITING DISPOSTION FROM PGH.

  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=703554083498 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1845 CLASS=90 QTY UOM=Solid - Kilogram PSN TEXT=Dry Ice PKG GRP=N/A SPILLED QTY=0.0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=22.7 CONTAINER UOM=Solid - Kilogram MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=D - Fiberboard or cardboard NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=3 - Box TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=22.7 TOTAL UOM=Solid - Kilogram )The shipment was discovered leaking on an inbound flight. UN 1866 (5 Steel/Metal Drums) and UN1845,(in Styrofoam) Overpacked in a Corrugated Box. UN 1866 Resin Solution leaked from 1- Steel/Metal Can (Closed Head) that was dented on the side. The Dry Ice, UN 1845 did not escape the outer packaging. The shipment was held for shipper dispostion, then picked up by the customer.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Two Veolia employees were unloading a trailer at the Veolia Henderson TSDF, when a pressurized drum was observed. The drum was contained on a pallet on the trailer floor, but appeared to be slightly leaning. An employee attempted to carefully move the drum to a position where it could be managed and depressurized. While re-positioning, the base of the drum split away from the bottom chime, and caused approximately 45 gallons of waste flammable liquids to release onto the trailer floor, secondary containment beneath the trailer, and the receiving dock. The two employees immediately went inside of the office building and contacted Veolia's Emergency Coordinator to report the spill at 22:55 MST. The Emergency Coordinator arrived onsite at 23:30 MST and verified the released material as UN1993 Waste Flammable Liquids at 00:06 MST. A D001 reportable quantity of 100 lbs triggered a report of the incident to the NRC. The NRC report began at 00:17 MST (NRC Report Number 1408646). The spill was also reported to the Colorado Department of Public Health & Environment (CDPHE) using the online environmental spill release report form, submitted at 00:36 MST. Veolia personnel conducted in house cleanup of the released material using absorbent material, and then pressure washed the area. No injuries or exposures occurred.

The customer/shipper was immediately notified of the release and the spill was cleaned up. Once the tanker returned to Veolia, the scrubber was emptied. An internal investigation determined that the most probable cause was that the scrubber was not emptied during the pre-trip inspection.

  • City: SCHENECTADY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During a drum transfer operation between trailers at Veolia's Schenectady, NY 10 day intransit facility, a Veolia employee accidentally punctured a 55-gallon steel drum containing Class 9 hazardous waste liquid. The puncture was caused by an unnoticed metal burr on the drum cart. The release duration was less than one minute resulting in approximately 1 liter of liquid leaked onto the trailer floor. The spill was cleaned using spill pads and absorbent material and the damaged drum was overpacked into an 85-gallon salvage drum for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

item.title: Report E-2024090104
item.description:
Report E-2024090104

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-10T09:23:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL CARRIERS INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Schneider Bulk Carriers notified ERTS of a cargo release in Waterloo, IA. It was reported that 2000 gallons of Performance XXL Alkali needs a transload or an off load from trailer # 28902 due to internal valve leaking. The release impacted asphalt and concrete. Update from the driver advised a small 80-gallon pool with product is filled and a second pool was being used to collect product, but the leak was steady. Clean Harbors arrived on site and advised an estimated 70-gallons were released and caught in the retention pits due to a internal valve leaking. The released product was collected and placed into a 275-gal tote. A vac truck was used to transfer the remainder of product from the tank. The transfer has been completed. The impacted plastics used for retention were cut and drummed. Due to the potential haz waste properties, (1) 275IBC w/ 70-gallons of Performance XXL Alkali; and (1) 55 DF w/ impacted plastic will be left onsite until the profiling was approved for a receiving facility.

The spill was limited to less than 2 gallons and remained confined within the trailer. Upon investigation, it was determined that the leak occurred due to improper securing of the load, which allowed the containers to shift during transportation. The spill was remediated by trained Veolia personnel and the container was properly closed.

item.title: Report X-2024090313
item.description:
Report X-2024090313

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-31
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: MULTI-PIECE SHIPMENT FROM USA TO CHINA WAS BEING LOADED FOR EXPORT FROM ANC TO CHINA WHEN TWO PACKAGES WERE FELT VIBRATING. TWENTY-ONE PACKAGES WERE FOUND IN THE SHIPMENT AND INSPECTED. INSPECTION REVEALS SEVERAL MASSAGERS CONTAINING LITHIUM ION BATTERIES IN EACH BOX. THE MASSAGERS WERE NOT SECURED TO PREVENT ACTIVATION AS MANY WERE IN THE "ON" POSITION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1ZG074D48841386634, 1ZG074D48842143242, 1ZG074D48841596667, 1ZG074D48841805476, 1ZG074D48840367291, 1ZG074D48840472300, 1ZG074D48840294717, 1ZG074D48840110521, 1ZG074D48840435734, 1ZG074D48842626346, 1ZG074D48840478359, 1ZG074D48841827765, 1ZG074D48842150574, 1ZG074D48840162789, 1ZG074D48841420391, 1ZG074D48840919408, 1ZG074D48841695818, 1ZG074D48840425629, 1ZG074D48840024839 AND 1ZG074D48841249443. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM NEVADA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER G074D4, GZ HEYING TRADING CO., LTD, (SPB-A) RM602 NO. 8 HEBEI DATIAN 4 HENG RD, CAN CHINA MAINLAND.

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: HAMMOND

  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-40ft area of the trailer floor and concrete lot under the trailer and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released due to pallet puncturing one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Clean Harbors personnel neutralized the impacted area and containerized the recovered material into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums along with impacted pallet pieces and the damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-20ft area of the trailer floor and a 1ft-by-1ft area of concrete underneath the trailer and estimated that eight (8) gallons of material was released. Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify the damage, deployed absorbents, and then cleaned the released material. The damaged cardboard, containers, and recovered material was placed into six (6) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the top of the drum and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due to a defective cap.   • City: PAINESVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While in transit the driver noticed material on the side of his tank and pulled off and inspected the trailer 1030et. He discovered the the seal on the manhole was not seating properly and the material was seeping out onto the tank. They sent out a new tank and a temporary containment so that the material could be safely transferred. The new tank showed up at 1330et and the temporary containment arrived at 1600et. They then set up the containment and transferred the material into the new tank. The material that got on the side of the tank was cleaned off and put into a salvage drum for proper disposal. The transfer and break down of the containment took about an hour and they were back on the road by 1700et.

item.title: Report I-2024080121
item.description:
Report I-2024080121

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-06T09:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: Paducah
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PADUCAH & LOUISVILLE RAILWAY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3912
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: a consist of 5 Iocomotives(2 of which was a mother/slug set PAL 2119/PAL 2112) that was fueled and prepared for an evening outbound train at the Paducah Diesel shop(3700 Starnes Avenue) was transported from the shop to the north end of paducah yard(approximately 1/2 to 3/4 of a mile) to put on oubound train set to depart that evening. The crew first used the power to pull some cars from the rip track to set over into a track and then backed in to track #8 to couple into outbound train before.pulling it to the north end of yard to stage for outbound crew. Once train was parked at north end of track#8, the conductor noticed fuel Ieaking from the PAL 2119 mother Iocomotive out the overflow on fuel tank. The crew reported it to diesel shop immediately and were instructed to shut the fuel transfer breaker off on the slug unit PAL 2112 and the leak stopped. E3 environmental(Enhanced Environmental and Emergegency) was contacted and showed up to yard to clean all affected areas. Clean up was completed and all tracks put back in service at 2050. The manual transfer switch on the PAL 2119 was later determined to be the cause of the overflow. The PAL 2119 was calling for fuel transfer when it was already full. This switch was replaced to prevent event from happening again.

  • Description: XPO-USA contacted ERTS to report a spill of 1-cup Crystalline Potassium Nitrate from a 50lb plastic bag. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product were released affecting a 2’x2’ area of the trailer floor. The contractor collected and containerized the Crystalline Potassium Nitrate and all clean-up debris into two (2) 55- gallon drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XFM experienced a UN3267 Sika FerroGard 903 release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete lot below. The pail was crushed as a result of stacking. The impacted area was cleaned with pads and granular absorbents. The damaged pail and all cleanup debris were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090005
item.description:
Report E-2024090005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: JESSUP
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XJP notified ERTS of a damaged 400 pound drum of UN1807 Phosphorus Pentoxide that was just picked up from a customer. XPO personnel noticed the drum had a small puncture at the bottom upon arrival. The drum lost a small amount of material, but the spill did not happen at their terminal or in the trailer, per XPO, and they confirmed the drum was not actively leaking. ERTS dispatched contractors to assist with overpacking, however XPO terminal personnel overpacked the damaged drum. The drum was held at XPO's terminal pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024090215
item.description:
Report X-2024090215

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FRA Hazmat Inspector John Powell identified GATX 286323 with residue on exterior of car during an inspection at the BNSF Terminal in Spokane, WA on 8/26/2024. The source appeared to come from the man way area and all man way swing bolts were inspected and found to be tool tight. Upon arrival to the BNSF Railway Pasco, WA Terminal the car was then identified again by BNSF Mechanical who were aware of the prior inspection and removed the man way lid to inspect the gasket. The gasket was identified as an insert gasket on the man way lid but was also identified as deteriorated due to no longer having the compression to allow a complete seal on the nozzle. BNSF Mechanical HM Responders removed the gasket and replaced with a man way nozzle gasket to allow continued movement.

item.title: Report E-2024090011
item.description:
Report E-2024090011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 29, 2024, at 0740 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Grand Prairie, Texas regarding the release of Techno Adhesive #199. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 110 gallons of Techno Adhesive #199 (UN1593, Adhesive, Dichloromethane (mixture), 6.1, III) from (2) 55-gallon DM’s. The release was caused by a forklift puncture and impacted 20ft x 8ft area of the trailer floor and a 20ft x 4ft area of concrete beneath the tanker. Contractors placed the 2 damaged drums into overpacks and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (7) 55-gallon DF’s and (2) 95-gallon DF overpacks then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024090013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-28
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NKX experienced a UN1814 Cal Clean 947 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor. The crew advised the release occurred due to the valve being open. The valve was closed and tightened, and a slosh test was conducted to ensure there would be no further release. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents. All waste was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090017
item.description:
Report E-2024090017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: HAMILTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 27, 2024, at 1806 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Hamilton, Ohio regarding the release of Houghto-Etch AX-2040. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 cup of Houghto-Etch AX-2040 (UN2817, Ammonium Hydrogendiflouride Solution, 8, 6.1, II) from (1) 55-gallon DF. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted a 2ft x 1ft area of concrete. The damaged drum was placed in an 85-gallon DF overpack, absorbents and neutralizer were then used to clean the release. All waste was containerized in (1) 5-gallon DF, and (1) 85-gallon DF overpack then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024090169

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARK APPLIED WITHOUT ADDITIONAL DANGEROUS GOODS SHIPPING PAPERS, MARKS OR LABELS. DURING THE DOWNGRADE AND RETURN TO SHIPPER PROCESS THE CONTENTS WERE DISCOVERED LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS, WE DISCOVERED THREE GALLON CANS OF SPECPOXY 1000 PARTS A AND B INSIDE THE BOX. TWO OF THE CANS CONTAIN SPECPOXY 1000 PART A WHICH ARE NON-REGULATED. THE THIRD CAN CONTAINS SPECPOXY 1000 PART B WHICH IS REGULATED AS UN2735, AMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. ALL THREE CANS WERE LEAKING DUE LOOSE LIDS. ADDITIONALLY, THE CANS ARE DENTED.

item.title: Report E-2024090010
item.description:
Report E-2024090010

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN1760 "CL5789" from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 quarts of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a pallet nail puncture. The damaged jug was placed into a 20-gallon poly drum. Absorbents and vinegar solution were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted concrete. All impacted absorbents and pallet pieces were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024090090
item.description:
Report X-2024090090

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-26
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: car was reported releasing vapor with an audible hiss and odor. Code 3 arrived and determined that the PRD was releasing. The pressure was 160 psi and 17" of outage. Since the car was in outbound, and VOC readings were detected at ground level, a midland kit was applied and the car moved to an isolated track. The shipper was contacted to dispatch a repair company. SRS was contacted by the shipper. It was determined that this was the fist load since being requalified at the shop. The car was monitored until it could be transferred, then cleaned and purged. After cleaning the PRD was sent to a facility to be tested and determined that it was set to operate at 159 psi. Car is in hold waiting an OTMA

item.title: Report X-2024090135
item.description:
Report X-2024090135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/23/2024 at approximately 1400, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 5007286 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 1 fiberboard box that contained 3 plastic containers labeled as "Muriatic Acid". Dangerous Goods Administration obtained an online safety data sheet, which classified the commodity as UN 1789 Hydrochloric Acid. Two of the three containers leaked from the closure, resulting in spillage. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the requred markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The spillage also compromised the integrity of the shipping label and the outer package; however, the inner contents are being held, pending an FAA investigation. The shipment contained the identical contents as were reported in Spill Incident #20260. This shipper has been placed on embargo list.

  • City: OAK CREEK

  • Description: RESPONDER CLEANED UP A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE PINK SIDE BOX LINE. 6/6 CANS OF ADHESIVE CLEANER WERE LEAKING DUE TO LOOSE CAPS. ONE CAP WAS EVEN COMPLETELY OFF THE BOTTLE. UPON OPENING AND INSPECTING THE PACKAGE THE INNER PACKAGING WAS FOUND TO HAVE LIMITED QUANTITY MARKINGS AND PAINT UN1263 CLASS 3 PG III. THE OUTER PACKAGING DID NOT HAVE ANY LIMITED QUANTITY MARKINGS. RMP WAS NOTIFIED AND CONTACTED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: EDGERTON
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE HAZMAT WITH ALL PPE WHICH INCLUDED BOOTS, GOOGLES, SILVER INNER LINER SHEILDS, GLOVES, APRON, AND SLEEVES. THEN PREFORMED AN INVESTIGATION TO ENSURE THE PROPER WAY TO RESPOND TO THE PACKAGE. THEN FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE WHICH LED TO PH TAPE IT AND THEN USED SODIUM BICARBITIN TO NUETRILLIZE THE CHEMICAL. THEN THE DECISION TREE HAD RESPONDER PUT IT ON CART WITH SPILL TRAY WITH LINER, ESURING TO USE PLASTIC DUSTPAN AND BROOM, AFTER IT WAS ALL DONE AND THE SODIUM BICARBIN WAS ACTIVATED, RESPONDER FINISHED CLEANING UP THE SPILL.

item.title: Report E-2024090058
item.description:
Report E-2024090058

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: EDEN PRAIRIE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XEN experienced a roadside release of UN1139 SRW Low Gloss X-Treme from (5) 5-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to an 8’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor. Approximately 10 ounces of product impacted the trailers undercarriage and a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete lot below. The pails were crushed due to improper securement of the pallet and load shift. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents and pads which were containerized along with impacted debris into a 55- gallon metal drum. The damaged pails were containerized into a 55-gallon metal and 15-gallon poly drums. The waste was transported to XPO Logistics terminal located in Eagan, MN for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On August 22, 2024, one (1) 2-gallon jug of UN3149 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. Upon arrival, the crew discovered that terminal personnel had already deployed soda ash to the spill. MSES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3149-impacted dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024090134
item.description:
Report X-2024090134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08/21/2024 at approximately 1330, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 317901 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting spillage from undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 3 - 1 gallon plastic containers packaging inside of a fiberboard box. Each plastic container contained muriatic acid. The shipment was discovered to a have spilled from the closure of each of the plastic containers. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it did not display the required markings, labeling, packaging and paparwork. The shipment has been place in a salvage drum and is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA. Upon release by the FAA, the shipment will be sent for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090008
item.description:
Report E-2024090008

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: SANGER

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 21, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged pails and all impacted materials were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct onsite cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-oiunces of product released to the pallet of cardboard boxes on the dock only. The release was suspected to occur due to heat and expansion of the material in the bottles as the caps on the jugs were leaking. The impacted cardboard and faulty jugs were collected into (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO-XHG contacted ERTS to report a spill. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the packaging and shrink-wrap and estimated that twelve (12) ounces of material were released due to loose caps. First Call Environmental personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify the damage. The bottles with bad seals were placed into six (6) 55-gallon poly drums and the impacted absorbents and cardboard were placed into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization

item.title: Report E-2024090027
item.description:
Report E-2024090027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: BURTON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 29th at 0900et it was discovered that 4 containers on rail car GIMX516137 was leaking document numbers 018679127FLE, 018679125FLE, 018679126FLE, and 018679124FLE. The team on sight called for an response team to come address the release. The response team showed up and contained and put down absorbent to clean up the release. There was approximately 5gallons of material that was released and collected and added back to the containers. It was determined that 2 of the roll of containers were damaged and the material needed to be transferred into new containers. There was special equipment needed to accomplish this so everything was contained and the equipment arrived on July 30th and the material was transferred to the new containers. There was more absorbent material added to the container to solidify any liquid and was then monitored for 24hrs. On July 31st the cleanup was complete and the containers were ready for shipment.

Report E-2024090052

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XBO) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to unknown reasons, an unknown amount of Transchem Muriatic Acid (UN1789) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor at door 36. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the packaging and pallet and estimated that three (3) cups of material was released due to heat causing the material to expand. HEPACO personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify the damage. The impacted product and cardboard was placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.
